title: Supporters and opponents of Trump's refugee ban take to social media to put pressure on companies
text: On Saturday evening, the New York Taxi Workers Alliance, whose membership is largely Muslim and Sikh and almost universally immigrant, called for a work stoppage — including by drivers for the ride-share company Uber — at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York. Uber tweeted that evening that surge pricing — the fare increase that typically accompanies an increase in demand — had been turned off at JFK.
summary:
On Saturday evening, the New York Taxi Workers Alliance, whose membership is largely Muslim and Sikh and almost universally immigrant, called for a work stoppage — including by drivers for the ride-share company Uber — at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York.
Uber tweeted that evening that surge pricing — the fare increase that typically accompanies an increase in demand — had been turned off at JFK.
